Reviews.Title: “Dreadful no sleep”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: Can't believe this hotel had rating of 8.5 overall on trip advisor, positioning of hotel in Barcelona is good but as for rooms whilst ok, the Walls are paper thin and you do not get a good nights sleep, we were there three nights and had a different room per night, cleaners are banging about way to early, and if your unlucky enough to get unruly guests in other rooms as we were then it's a nightmare, after calling hotel reception approx four times for these obnoxious youths, nothing was done as there are no security and they are not prepared to call police and the situation could of really boiled over, enough said. Simply do not go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LondonRick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip in Barcelona and overall this ticked all the boxes. Check in was easy, staff very friendly and the lobby is nicely styled. The room was a good size, clean with a comfortable bed, decent bathroom. The only issue was lack of light, The window was literally tiny. As I was in meetings all day and at dinner in the evening it worked out fine however had I been there on vacation then I would have found the room a little dissappointing. Breakfast was excellent, fresh and plentiful. Hotel overall well decorated and clean, staff very friendly and helpful and the location to the Ramblas and the all the main attractions excellent. I would definitely consider staying again, perhaps in a different room!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: MAXWILLDESIGN
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel to stay at and enjoy the flavor of Barcelona! Very convenient to stores and everything as well as the main train stations. Also a 3 minute walk to the Aerobus direct to the airport. Rooms are very clean but can be a bit noisy at times. Front desk could be more accommodating - it was frustrating to check in and get separate beds for my daughter and myself. Had to change rooms the next day. And almost impossible to upgrade to a room with a balcony... which i would strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel,perfect area,we loved it”
Reviews.Author: pierre c
Reviews.Content: Really good position,in the center of Barcelona,very close to the cathedral,the ramblas and the picasso museum. The staff was very lovely,and the breakfast buffet OMG!! it was just awesome!! we absolutely loved it,we know already we will be back in barcelona,and in the same hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: DBeer
Reviews.Content: can't beat the location, beautiful interior, was once a palace, friendly staff, large rooms. We were there off season and the price we got on line was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “New Years in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Railman
Reviews.Content: We spent New Years Eve in Barcelona. We had dinner at a local restaurant, and it was delightful. The Catalonia Potal del Angel Hotel was a great choice. The room, terrace, cleanliness, and amenities were first rate. The breakfast each morning was excellent in terms of quality and choices. the hotel staff, particularly reception could not have been more accommodating. The location, in the heart of the old city, is perfect for touring.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice historical building”
Reviews.Author: clafromitaly
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a weekend last spring, and found it in a perfect location for visiting&shopping, and a short walk to plaza de Catalunya so also close to the bus for the airport. The building is old in a lovely way, with a huge stairway and a nice historical atmosphere. We had a big room with a balcony overlooking the street, which can be a bit noisy (but just a bit: the street is pedestrians only) but offers a nice view on a very lively crowd. Breakfast was plenitful, the staff efficient and helpful, the price was all right, so this definitively a hotel to recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tigerbeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights pre cruise and had a wonderful time .the location is excellent ,walking distance to marina , shops and Placa catalunya, metro not far away either. Only negative was our room was supposed to be a double and we had separate twin beds . We chose not to make a fuss about this ,the beds were a little hard though. Still would recommend this to all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Michael190739
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in early November and the excellent location, just to the south of Placa Catalunya, ensured that we could walk easily to many of the city's attractions. It also meant that the hotel was within 5 minutes walk of the airport bus service stop in Placa Catalunya. The reception staff were especially helpful and those in the breakfast area very pleasant. We had a standard room which was satisfactory, given that we merely used the room to sleep, but the window that looked out on to a wall might make the room stuffy in warmer times. However, this is a city centre hotel, as opposed to somewhere in the countryside or at the beach where a view might be more desirable, and an upgraded room was offered although we turned it down. We were not troubled by any noise. As mentioned before, a great location and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location/helpful service”
Reviews.Author: jolnj
Reviews.Content: Since we had only two days and like to sight-see non-stop, we paid a little more than we typically do for the perfect location: 2 minute walk from Plaza de Catalunya - the hub of activity and transportation to airport plus any part of city by metro, city bus, or tourist bus - in the lively old city; one block parallel to La Ramblas; just a mile or so to the sea. Shops, restaurants, history, just around each bend. We couldn't have been more delighted. My request for early check-in was granted, allowing for a nap after overnight flight. Double windows open to street noise but allow good ventilation and effectively blocked noise when closed. Curtains blackened room totally for daytime nap. Street noise definitely eased up after 10 PM, even on weekends. Hotel staff was friendly and clerk on evening duty Friday was particularly friendly and helpful in providing information about transportation and sights. We had little desire to try (expensive) hotel breakfast since Le Boqueria market is so close and has anything you could want, plus Starbucks coffee nearby. Only drawbacks were charge to use internet service on hotel computer - free wifi is available if you bring your own devices - and translucent bathroom doors which, in the middle of the night, allow one guest's use of bathroom to interfere with roommate's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in BCN, but standard rooms arentoo basic”
Reviews.Author: olbow
Reviews.Content: Spend there 5 nights, we were offered to upgrade our standard room to a premium room for 30 eur per day and it was worth it as the standard room we saw was not acceptable (size of the bed plus 50 cm around, a window showing sight to a wall 1 m outside). Appart from that, excellent location, good breakfast! Maybe a bit noisy as noise isolation was quite poor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Fiestafiesta
Reviews.Content: excellent staying in the centre of barcelona, big shopping streets around the corner! near the old city centre... quality/price = perfect

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, most helpful and friendly staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: hayutyogev
Reviews.Content: We couldn't expect more than this lovely, perfect located hotel. The staff was most helpful, friendly and anxious to give us the best experience of Barcelona. The room was wonderful, and breakfast was tasty. We will defiantly recommend hotel Catalonia Portal de l'Angel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “No room at the inn”
Reviews.Author: west21high
Reviews.Content: After being up and traveling for 26 hours from the Seattle area we arrived at our hotel. The clerk agreed that we had reservations but there were no vacancies. They would be happy to put us up at one of their other hotels. It would only be a five minute walk, at night, with our suitcases through an unfamiliar city with an unfamiliar language. After our objections they agreed to pay for the 15 minute cab ride. Two other couples we were meeting up with had the same experience. Advice. Don't count on them.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Place to Stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Bluebirds277
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights here during a recent visit to Barcelona. The guy at the front desk was very friendly and helpful and check in was a breeze. We upgraded to a Premium Room for an extra 20 Euros/night so I don't know what the standard rooms are like. Our room was modern and spacious. It overlooked the very busy & noisy pedestrian street Portal de L'Angel, but the double windows are pretty good at sound proofing. Also, the foot traffic and noise really dropped off after about 10:00. For an additonal 10 Euros/night there are Premium Terrace rooms available that open onto a quiet courtyard in the rear of the building. Those concerned about noise might want to consider these. We opted for the hotel's buffet breakfast, which was very good. Lots of choices of things to eat and a large and attractive breakfast room in the rear courtyard. As others have pointed out, the hotel is in a great location for sight seeing, dining, shopping, etc. The only negative about our stay was that it was very warm and humid in Barcelona. We appreciated the complementary bottled water in our Premium Room, but our AC was not very effective. We were always a little warm in the room. Another reason to consider the Premium Terrace rooms is that you can open the balcony doors to let cool breezes into your room. When we opened the windows in our room, the noise from outside was a little too much for us. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Catalonia Portal de l'Angel”
Reviews.Author: philkemus
Reviews.Content: We really had a great trip to Barcelona and it started with the check in to this hotel. We had reserved a superior room with a terrace and none were available so we were quickly pgraded to their only suite. It was a duplex on the top floor with the bedroom upstairs(nothing but the bedroom) in a turret on the roof. While it was somewhat difficult because you had to go downstairs to go to the bathroom, it was incredibly private and even quiet in the center of the old city tourist and shopping area. The location was great and it really made our trip easy and comfortable. It wasn't perfect but in my mind this 3 star hotel was really the value of a 4 star in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, loved the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Clouds75
Reviews.Content: For tourists planning a visit to Barcelona, this hotel is in an excellent location. It's an easy walk to the Placa de Catalunya (a transportation hub) and walking-distance to both the Barri Gotic and l'Eixample. Once inside the hotel, you encounter a delightful staircase and court that are vestiges of a historic building. Everything is clean. We stayed in a "Premium Terrace" guestroom that had a balcony with a table and chairs; the balcony overlooked a rear patio--definitely worth the extra euros. Also the rear location meant we heard no noise from the street. The room itself was a bit on the small size, although not tight. There was a desk with a chair, but no second chair. The decorating was slightly off-key--fake wood floors and black bedspreads--but it wasn't terrible, either. The best part was the bathroom. It was spacious, with a long counter, a large mirror, and walls and floor covered in a beautiful reddish regional stone. Air conditioning worked well. As for breakfast, you may choose to buy it nearby as there are lots of options. But we enjoyed the hotel breakfast, which included fresh fruit, several types of eggs and meat, cheeses, flaky croissants and bread. The staff was great, and one member helped us make a restaurant reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Alinta B
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I booked a sister hotel which did not meet the description and ultimately they referred me to this hotel. This hotel was great. I had a room on the upper storey with a balcony which overlooked rooftops etc. It was magical. The room was clean and well decorated, and the bathroom was good. There are lifts, and there is an internal staircase which is lovely. The food was good, and the staff helpful. The location is fabulous - in the old district and one minute to the Palaca de Catalunya. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Location!!"”
Reviews.Author: italioie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for 1 week. The location is perfect for everyone travelling to Barcelona, literally a 1 minute walk and you will be on Placa de Catalunya. We were upgraded to a terraced room overlooking the pool where we enjoyed bottles of Cava before out nights out the clubs around Port Olympic. The rooms were cleaned on a daily basis and had everything we needed for out trip. The Swimming pool only gets a few hours of sunshine a day unless you plan on dragging the lounger all around trying to catch some rays. We found the staff in the restaurant a little rude and there English language skills weren't very good. I asked for a food menu over 3 x times in the empty restaurant and after 10 minutes having been left sitting there we left and ate in a different restaurant. The bar wasn't exactly exciting so we would venture out and drink in the many bars around the Ramblas. I will definitely be returning to Barcelona and will consider staying in this hotel beacuse of the great location but that is the only reason why i would be returning.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: This property claims to be a 3 star hotel. There is nothing 3 star about this hotel except the price. The hotel is centrally located right in the heart of Barcelona's shopping precinct. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and spacious, we stayed in a balcony room overlooking the couryard and pool - just lovely. We loved Barcelon and this hotel so much that we changed our plans and returned rather than heading off to Turkey. The beds are comfortable as are the pillows. All in all could not fault this hotel. The pool was a huge attracton for us after having spent the day shopping, sightseeing or at the beach for which we recomend hiring a bike. The hotel also offers complimentary unlimited WiFi which I found invaluable given that we had a business back home to be in touch with.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Jhl1790
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at this hotel after a very long flight and were served by desk staff Carlos and David. They were very pleasant and responsive when we needed to change our room. They also assisted us with directions to a small town which was invaluable. They were always very friendly with good people skills and willing to assist

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: greymanEly
Reviews.Content: A haven of peace and quite close to the shops, restaurants and tourist attractions. Excellent room, friendly staff who went out of their way to help, great breakfast buffet and excellent lunch, nice pool although loungers were not very comfortable and not many of them. Would have no hesitation in staying there again or in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Very nice Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Perseus61
Reviews.Content: Great location (easy walking distance to La Ribera, Las Ramblas, Eixample, Bari Gottic, near main subway station too)....hotel was very clean and well kept....Has a pool, breakfast is included...only 2 people per room so a family of 4 or more requires two rooms, so it was pricey, but remember you are paying for central location......

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Nadakhaled
Reviews.Content: we traveled to barcelona on 17th of july and we loved the hotel because of the location is perfect 2 min. away from la ramblas ,1 min. away from station for the touristic bus , in very good area for shopping ' zara , bershka , massimo dutti , H&m , pull and bear. The reception were helpful and smiling especially the night shift and the breakfast was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Once you pay for the upgrade, it's good value”
Reviews.Author: zoshi
Reviews.Content: I purchased this accommodation through Wotif, and the room (just a bit bigger than the bed) was small and dark, off a noisy corridor with a large gap under the door. The window looked out onto other windows. After the first night, for 20 euros, we upgraded to a pool view room with small balcony - very worthwhile. The front of the hotel throws you into a very busy shopping mall; the back of the hotel overlooks the pool and internal courtyard arrangement. A very short walk from Los Ramblas; probably 30 minutes steady walk to beach. In all, a very convenient location. You can also pay extra for a late checkout.

Reviews.Title: “okayish”
Reviews.Author: starsanai
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only a night after disembarking from cruiseship. the location is excellent and helpful staff. Didn't like the rooms much as the windows don't open and it gets claustophobic and stuffy inside! The airconditioning was'nt working well either. Toilets are ok but again did'nt like the glass doors (which don't even lock). Its quite a new trend which I'm sure is quite annoying to people who are not couples.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: quyty
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the centre of Barcelona with very reasonable price, it is on the pedestrian quarter, with shops and restaurants are surrounded. The hotel is close to La Rambla, the main road that leads to the harbour. The staffs are helpful and take your queries seriously. There is only 1 minute walk to Tourism Office, 5 minutes walk to the market for low price and fresh Tapas, and 10 minutes walk to Picasso Museum, etc... Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay, we will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: LouiseMalta
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the positive comments on Trip Advisor. This hotel is really fantastic. Right in the middle of everything. It is located on a busy pedestrian-only street and taxis let you off about a block from the hotel – in the Placa de Catalonia – If you arrive or leave early in the morning a taxi can come to the door which is very convenient especially if you have lots of luggage.) If you're going to do some shopping, which obviously is something you can't resist yourself from doing when you're in Barcelona, this is the hotel you should stay in, because it is surrounded by all the grand fashion names of women and men's fashion clothing. Next door to the hotel is Berscka, Zara, Mango, and opposite the hotel is Benetton, H&M, and many many others. We booked a standard room and when arriving at the hotel I noticed that the room window was a bit small and claustrophobic. I went down to the reception and thanks to Quentin, he arranged for us to change the room with a balcony facing the pedestrian street. And although outside was very noisy inside with the door shut, was a very quite place. The room was comfortable and well appointed -- not huge but adequate for two people. The decor of the room was really nice with a huge bathroom. When you walked out the front door of the hotel we were just steps from the Cathedral, Palau de Musica and El Corte Ingles – the big department store. The staff were really friendly and always tried to do their best to help in any way possible. They spoke English well – and were extremely helpful in giving directions and suggestions. We liked everyone we met especially Quentin and Sergi and the lovely lady with long hair, (sorry I can't remember her name) were particularly helpful to us when we asked for assistance. Even the maids were friendly and the room was very clean. We loved that wi-fi was free. Breakfast was really good, cheeses, cold meat, cereals, fruit and cakes and pastries... This is really a lovely hotel. We would certainly go back there if we return to Barcelona. Thanks for making our stay a very memorable one :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, we would come back”
Reviews.Author: lauraloo72
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, staff really helpful. Room good size lovely big bathroom. Spotlessly clean. Our window opened onto a corridor and not outside so although initially I was dissapointed it was so lovely and peaceful we slept really well as we heard no noise at all. Mini bar prices and bar prices were good. Didn't use the pool as it was busy but a great facility ,and a really central location. Would come back

Reviews.Title: “Tiring experience”
Reviews.Content: As noted, a great location and from the outside it appears to be a very nice hotel which we had looked forward to staying at prior to a week's cruise. We booked a room a couple of months in advance and prior to arriving had attempted to confirm the reservation thru their website with no luck. After a 12 hr flight, a half hr cab ride and lugging baggage for a couple of blocks (the hotel is on a pedestrian only street) we arrived at the hotel only to hear that there had been a "reservations problem" and our reservation had been transferred to another hotel. We were "matter of factly" given a map and sent on our way carrying luggage for several blocks to the other side of Catalunya Plaza thru a large crowd of demonstrators. Luckily, a very nice man pointed us in the direction of the new hotel. The new hotel was comparable, tho we didn't get the type of room that we had requested. Also, we met another couple experiencing the same switch. Barcelona is a beautiful city, so we quickly adjusted, but this was certainly not the way we had hoped to start our vacation. It is hard to believe that they just realized the problem and it would have been easy enough to inform us of the switch before we arrived. Secondly, the front desk staff could have easily offerred to walk us to the new hotel, which would have made a huge difference in our experience. There are a lot of hotel options in Barcelona near Las Ramblas/Catalunya Plaza that I would choose before I took a chance on this one or others in their group.

Reviews.Title: “At first we thought it was the smell that stunk !”
Reviews.Author: 50somethingtraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 9 nights 2 months in advance. All levels of rooms were available when we booked and we opted for a premium room. When we arrived we were put into an interior room that when we stepped in had so much room deoderizer that it burned our eyes. When we opened the door to the bathroom we found out why, it smelled like a sewer. No other rooms were avaiable so we spent 1 night with the window open...did not help much. The next day we were given a front room with the real premium rooms still not being available. One never did open up and we spent the next 8 nights in a small room with poor air conditioning. All close by hotels were booked at this point. We were chumped,the staff conviently lost the ability to speak English when we tried to address the issues. Oh, a weekly rate was not available for our 9 night stay. Stay away !

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION !!!”
Reviews.Author: Beth095
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before a cruise, the hotel was great .as indicated, the location was perfect , so much quieter than Ramblas. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- friendly staff. Ideal and good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: English5
Reviews.Content: We have just had a long weekend in Barcelona. We had a great time and were very pleased with the standard of this hotel. Fab location near shops bars and restaurants. The building has some beautiful original features and the sun deck with small pool was a real bonus when the shopping was done. Modern rooms with decent bathroom. Will definitely return to this hotel and have recommended it to others. We skipped breakfast after the first day and chose to eat in the small cafes with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: iberry
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests this hotel is in a fantastic location. You are only a minute away from Placa de Catalunya. From here you can catch all the main tourist buses or if you prefer to do it on your own catch a train from Catalunya metro station from which you can get to most of the sites. You are on a main shopping street and a block away from Las Ramblas. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes in the area too. Breakfast wasnt included in the price and we didnt eat at the restuarant in the hotel so I cant comment on the food. We ate breakfast at Cafe Zurich just down the road most mornings where you can get a coffee and a crossaint or a breakfast baguette for a pretty reasonable price and sit in the sun and watch the people go by at the same time. There were tea and coffee facilities in our room but no milk. Not a big deal but worth noting. They offer free wifi but the details in our room were wrong so if you have trouble connecting call up reception and they will give you the correct details to login. The only downside was that it could be a little noisy in the mornings if your a light sleeper. There was no problem with noise from other rooms but you seemed to be able to hear everything out in the corridors. It is an old building so its to be expected. The rooms have all been done up and decorated nicely. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pearl in the centre of a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: JC1954
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise we had when we arrived at the beautiful hotel right in the middle of Barcelona. Situated close to the airport, taxi fare circa €20.00, this hotel was a relevation. Its splendid decor with spacious rooms set in a 19th century gothic style building is eye catching and you feel the history. The staff were top class and the food was excellent. They have a wonderful menu at very reasonable prices with a flavour of the local cuisine served in a sspacious and comfortable setting. The manager Joacim and his staff could not have been more helpful and all you have to do is ask and you will not be dissapointed. The hotel is good value and you are close to the centre of all the activities and the tour busses is only 100 metres away. I would reccomend this hotel to any discerning traveller and you will not be dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “excelente en servicio y ubicacion”
Reviews.Author: ellenmundy
Reviews.Content: we spent most of our time in other parts of the country and had very little time to see parts of barc. But the staff, Oscar Bujosa, spent time with us and showed us key sites to see near by. He even gave us a great dinner recommendation. THanks to him for his courtesy and service we were able to see alot of great barce. we recommend this hotel to our friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: isk_99
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel purely because of positive comments on Trip Advisor. Now we know why: this hotel is really terrific. It is located on a busy pedestrian-only street and taxis let you off about a block from the hotel – in the Placa de Catalonia – which is also where the airport bus leaves you. (If you have lots of luggage we suggest you call ahead and make arrangements for them to help you with your bags. If your arrive or leave early in the morning a taxi can come to the door.) We booked a Premium Double with Terrace room because we wanted some outdoor space with our room for our 5 night stay – we like to “picnic” when we travel and knew a terrace and chairs and table were important to us. We used the terrace for breakfasts and some dinners. The courtyard was quiet and very pleasant. (The outdoor pool was not in use when we were there but closes at 8:00pm so it wouldn't be noisy at night when its open.) The room was comfortable and well appointed -- not huge but adequate for two people. It faced the back of the building overlooking the lovely courtyard. You felt as if you were in the quiet countryside rather than the middle of the bustling Barri Gothic section of Barcelona. Yet when you walked out the front door of the hotel you were just steps from the Cathedral, Palau de Musica and El Corte Ingles – the big department store that has a houses a huge supermarket. (We never checked out other rooms but other reviews indicated that street facing rooms were quiet when windows were closed. and some of the hotel’s rooms face inner courtyards.) The staff was courteous and considerate. They spoke English well – and were extremely helpful in giving directions and suggestions. We liked everyone we met -- Miguel and Oscar were particularly helpful to us when we asked for assistance. Even the maids were friendly and the room was very clean – and made up quickly and efficiently when we left in the mornings. We loved that wi-fi was free…and the connection was fast and reliable. (We have previously stayed in hotels that charged up to $20 per hour of internet connection.) We did not try the hotel breakfast – we either used the coffee/tea service provided for breakfast or ate at one of the many nearby cafes. This is really a lovely hotel. We would certainly go back there if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: ElenaA_11
Reviews.Content: Location: on the central pedestrian street 3 min walk from Placa de Catalunya (where Aerobuses stop, and which is the central point of the city) and from the cathedral (which is the centre of the Gothic Quarter). Actually we walked almost everywhere. The district is absolutely safe, even when we were returning from a concert almost at midnight we did not encounter any antisocial elements. We had a standard double room. It was spacious enough, with a nice entrance hall and a spacious bathroom. The balcony looked on the street, but the room was absolutely quiet. And very clean. There was also free WiFi with a very good signal. For breakfast there was a rich choice of everything: cereals, cheeses, jamón, salami, boiled and fried eggs, fried bacon, pastries, fruit. Coffee was served in a pot, but if asked, they brought espresso from the bar. Breakfast was served in a marquee with palms and greenery all around.

Reviews.Title: “A moderate priced jewel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: oldgoat60898
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two nights before a cruise & two nights after our cruise. The hotel is in a perfect location. Steps from the city center & Las Ramblas. Our room was surprisingly large & comfortable for such a charming hotel at such an affordable price. The breakfast buffet in the morning was another great surprise, many steps above an average American hotel breakfast. A very nice assortment of meats, both hot & cold, eggs, pastries.cheese, etc. Not only was the buffet nice, but, the cleanliness & the service, couldnt have been any better. To say that the staff goes above and beyond to help you, would be an under statement. They speak very good English, and are happy to help you with directions or advice on Barcelona. You feel like a guest in thier home, rather than a paying customer. We were fortunate enough to meet the manager of the hotel, A man named Mr Racasins. He was very nice, and when you meet him, it`s easy to see why the hotel is such a pleasent place to stay. He truly cares about his guests, and doesnt hesitate to assist you with anything you need. A true gentleman. We look forward to our next trip to Barcelona, and our next visit to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service is Great!”
Reviews.Author: altryall
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and had a room with inside terrace. It was a nice room the only thing we did not like was that the bed was 2 twin put together. We asked to get one large bed but there was only a room with no terrace so we declined. Rooms were cozy and clean. The staff was very helpful in everything we needed or required. Migual and Mirah were especially nice. Helping us to select restaurants and sites and over all guides us when ever we needed direction. I would recommend this hotel and I will be coming back to it

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Traveler584
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights in the GREAT place in mid September of this year. It had many fine qualities and was in an EXCELLENT location! While Touring Gaudi's house my little wife fell on the last step of a staircase and hurt her knee. It didn't bother her too bad during the day but I was awakened in the middle of the night with her crying in pain. After looking at her swelling knee I got her a couple aspirin, headed for the front desk and the night clerk/manager was absolutely excellent. He got me a bag of ice and offered to call the Dr. and was just SUPER! The next morning he checked on us and thankfully the ice had taken down the swelling and my wife was feeling much better. If you are looking for a GREAT place to stay in Barcelona, my wife and I recommend Catalonia Albinoni!

Reviews.Title: “ideally located hotel for everything”
Reviews.Author: Bizmiller
Reviews.Content: Beautiful period hotel centrally located just off the Rambla. Excellent service from very friendly staff. Clean, comfortable rooms. We stayed in a premium room with a terrace which overlooked the pool and bar area. The room was well appointed and included a mini-bar which we took advantage of. All forms of local transport are just a stonesthrow away as the hotel is situated just off Catalunya Plaza which is a main transport hub. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in a great location, with a great staff and a beautiful terrace”
Reviews.Author: Raidington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Catalonia-Albonini in September 2010. First off, the location is perfect (close to Las Ramblas, walking distance from the beach and in the middle of great shops but still quiet in the evenings). It's also convenient to the high speed AVE train and the local metro (very easily accessed from the train station and the airport). During our stay, we experienced excellent attention and service from the staff, especially Camilo, who makes a mean mojito and went above and beyond to make our stay most enjoyable. If you bring your Rick Steve's Guidebook, breakfast is on the house (the food is great) and dinners in the garden restaurant run about 20 Euro (for a delicious 3 course meal) which is the best value we got anywhere in Spain. We will definitely stay here again when we visit Spain!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL !!!”
Reviews.Author: lilykfoury
Reviews.Content: this hotel is perfect it has a great location right in the middle of the shopping streets facing H&M ,very close to the mall el corte ingles and the ramblas street with all the restaurants and the boqueria ...the rooms are very clean , the staff is very nice , great breakfast and tasty food try the paella in their restaurants ,the drinks in bar are very affordable , the hotel has a great decoration modern but typically spanish at the same time...the only thing i didn't like was the small pool but who would swim in the pool when u have an amazing beach like barceloneta!!...i really recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: olgauwt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nts and found this hotel to be a great deal. while paying $80 had neat cute room, pool and polite staff. conveniently located near Ramblar , Gothic Quarter and airport bus shuttle. Great for a short stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mcteach77
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were in a room with a view of a concrete wall and ac wasnt working correctly. The next day we asked for our room to be changed. They did it w/o a fuss and the room was much better. It had a balcony over looking the pool. The beds were nicer as well. This hotel is in a great location! A block away form Las Ramblas. Just beware of your room location.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, but quiet!”
Reviews.Author: EllenElise
Reviews.Content: The hotel could not be better! Central in the midst of, yet not a sound from traffic. Atrium with swimming pool, was a small lung in the vibrant city. We had a room with a terrace, where it was good to be after a long day at the beach and the city. We think the breakfast was quite expensive, so we decided to organize ourselves. No problem, as there are many nice restaurants in the area that open early.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel to stay in the heart of Barcelona - yet very quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Yana_N1
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful time at this hotel during our weekend stay in Barcelona. We stayed in a superior room, which had a balcony outgoing to the yard with table and 2 chairs, big bathroom with all amenities, we had a safebox in the room (deposit payment), minibar with wine and champagne - everything needed. the stuff was helpful and very polite. The bar team very friendly and I got nice Mojito every night - and they even brought it to my room when I asked for I will stay there more if I go to Barcelona (this is my 3rd trip to Barcelona)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great superior room.”
Reviews.Author: BananaMonkies
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel for its amazing location, just a few hundred metres from Plaza Catalunya. I was lucky enough to get a superior room, which was very nice, although abit too dark-lit. They could've had a lamp on the desk, as I was barely able to see anything when sitting by it. The bed was very good, so was the pillow, and the room was very quiet. I sincerely recommend this hotel! Loved the dark wooden floor. Staff could've smiled and been more welcoming, but I have experienced this in all the hotels I've slept at in Spain, so I have nothing explicit to say about this certain hotel in regards of customer service. I also ate at the restaurant in the hotel, but felt like they just wanted me gone as soon as possible as I was a lone customer.

Reviews.Title: “not again...”
Reviews.Author: nelitodasilva
Reviews.Content: Location: unbeatable. Poor taste decor, wonderfull building, spectacular interior stairs... Room was clean but hugly decor, it was quite dark over the interior courteyard...no fun. Staff extremelly friendly! The mature man working nights is absolutelly outstanding welcoming people... Although the human treat is fantastic, i would not stay here again if no works are undertaken, and definatelly not stay in a room over the courteyard...pricey for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: menzachel
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, centrally situated- 10 min walk to Las Ramblas (good it is not located there-too noisy). Room was clean and spacious enough, it also had a balcony overlooking the pool. The staff were friendly and willing to help. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loacation”
Reviews.Author: Marvick5520
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel after our 11 days cruise. We got a preminum room for 109 Euro) on the 3rd floor & we got a surprise that there is a huge balcony overlooking the pool & the patio area. Free Wi-fi access. Room is clean & quiet. There is a safe in the room but need 50 Euro deposit for the lock/key. Not sure why need that when most of the newer safe using electronic lock...that could improve. The other thing is cost 2 Euro to print off the boarding pass (most hotels now is complimentary) In the heart of the shopping area & right next to the transportation hub. Cost only 25 Euro for taxi to the airport. Certainly will stay here again if the proce is right

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Lovely hotel for a city break!!!”
Reviews.Author: liveforever94
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Barcelona and need to say that we absolutley loved this hotel! Having read some of the earlier reveiws we were a little bit apprehensive but it was perfect! Brilliant located just a 30 second walk down from the plaza de catalunya (the main centre of Barcelona) and just a block away from La Ramblas which was perfect as it is always extremely busy and more expensive there, even though it is a must to walk down! The hotels street had its own busy atmosphere and shops and a very short walk to the gothic quarter (our favourite place). (If you get a taxi from the airport ask to go to the plaza de catalunya as they will not have a clue where the hotel is! because it is in the middle of a street of shops, just a short walk down from the plaza. Also there is a Aerobus which takes you to and from the airport which stops in the plaza de catalunya, we didnt know this and ended up spending 60 euro on taxis! get the bus!) The bathrooms in the hotel are clean and adequate, the maids came everyday and did a very good job, the restaurant food in the hotel is very expensive but if you go bed and breakfast there is plenty of choice of food (for free). We recommend Sinatras restaurant as a great place to eat in the gothic quarter! and the hard rock cafe is entertaining and a fun place to eat as well just round the corner from the hotel! the staff are lovely and all speak good english and we thoroughly recommend this hotel! (in reply to other reviews there were no bad smells when we were there, so it must have been a temporary problem as Barcelonas drains aren't the greatest)

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Cascol
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights from 17th - 20th September. Whist I do agree with the previous reviews, all we really cared about was the fantastic location. The breakfast was disappointing. There was a terrible odour that came from the plumbing which they tried to hide with a plug in air freshener. The balcony was pointless as there was no view and sitting out there or even sitting inside with the door open, you were overwhelmed with the smells of the kitchens cooking below. The rooms are a little outdated but I wouldn't say they are in desperate need of a makeover. We've stayed in worse in Europe for the same price! But like I said, the location was perfect. Being our first time to Barcelona, I really don't think we could have found somewhere better just by looking online. Another benefit was the free wifi which seems to be hard to get in Europe. We also found the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel - spend the time to look for another hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoRuby
Reviews.Content: The room we were given had a distinctly bad odor from the plumbing system. It would dissipate when we turned the air unit on but it was disgusting! When we complained about it, they told us there were no other rooms available for 3. Given that we were there for 2 nights, we did try looking for another hotel but didn't have sufficient time to do so. Another issue is regarding their charging us for breakfast when they said t was included with our room. They charged us for one of the two days and when we asked them to reverse the charge, they refused. The frnt desk person was new and being trained by another person and the other person told him in Spanish - thinking we didn't understand - that if we didn't pay the full bill, they would have to call the police! This was the worst of the customer service issues by a few of the front hotel staffat this hotel. And that terrible service extended beynd the breakfast situation. Spend the time to look for another hotel; there are so many in Barcelona and so many in the same area as this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bedrooms are in desperate need of repair”
Reviews.Author: luckeyone
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at this hotel on the 20th of sept for two nights i had asked for a balcony room and on arrival i was told that there was one available but with single beds only. when we got into the room that afternoon we could see that it was very drab and in need of a paint job there was small peices of glass on the floor that had not been swept up and you could see nothing from the balcony as it was over five foot high and made of brick,and in dier need of renovating,so you could only see the tops of the buildings at the rear of the hotel,the reception area and rear courtyard did not give away the secret that this hotels rooms are run down and not worth the money we paid to stay here . on our first night it rained and the rainwater started coming in through the bathroom roof i went down to the reception and they told me to go back and they would phone me when they phoned we were hoping that they would move us to another hotel as this was the only room available but suprise suprise! they ofered me a choice on the same floor the one we took had a double bed and balcony but still very drab and run down dirty floor tiles and cracked sink in the bathroom and a dirty old and flakey balcony and the spare pillow had no cover and was ready to be thrown away all in all this hotel totaly spoilt a very expensive trip to barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Wendy563
Reviews.Content: While the location of this hotel is ideal, the hotel itself is old and rundown. Our room was ok, althought the bathroom was large. We had requested a deluxe room that included additional amenities--we had to request every amenity from the front desk. None were provided without a request. On our last night, there was a power failure. I know that the staff did not cause the power outage, but they were poorly prepared. It is a real fire hazard to give candles to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Teefee61
Reviews.Content: This hotel, in the centre of the Gothic area of Barcelona, has a beautiful reception/ stairwell area. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and our room was clean and functional. It is expensive, I suppose because of its central location, because the quality of the rooms did not justify the price. It has a swimming pool, but this was tiny and bright green, so we weren't tempted. I was travelling with my two teenage daughters, and asked for a room for the three of us, but the extra bed was not very comfortable. Our room had no view, overlooking a tiny courtyard, but was otherwise adequate; clean and big enough. We arrived early in the day, and they were happy to look after our bags until our room was ready. When we got back from our walk at 2 p.m. our bags were already in our room. The breakfast area was pretty, and breakfast itself was quite good. The staff were always attentive and friendly. However, looking around at the courtyard where breakfast was served showed a mixture of new, old, and attempts to cover up run down aspects of the hotel itself. Unfortunately, on our first night, there was a power cut from 8 p.m. until 2 a.m. As the streets of Barcelona are a little dangerous at night, we stayed in our room with candles provided by the staff. It was obviously not their fault, and they did their best to cope with this difficult situation, but the fact that it happened seemed to reflect the slightly decrepit aspect we'd noticed in and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great shopping and signt seeing location”
Reviews.Author: deepc55
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located with easy access to all the main attractions of central Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, beautiful hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: jennyk79
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy with the Catalonia Albinoni. It is located just off the Ramblas (being a block away was actually nice). Our room was spacious, spotless, and well-appointed. The bathroom was very large by any standard, but even moreso for a city-center European location. We splurged for the balcony room with a view of the lovely pool and patio which was well worth it. Patricia and the rest of the front desk staff were very gracious and helpful in making us restaurant reservations and helping us plan our day to day activities.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: soycd115
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at this hotel in May. I booked a single room but had a lovely large stylish room with double bed. The hotel is ideally placed for the placa de catalunya where the airport and tourist buses drop off. The ramblas is a 2 min walk away, with the hotel being on a main shopping street. Couldnt fault the hotel or staff in any way. The breakfast was included and was lovely, cereal, fresh fruit, pastries, cooked breakfast. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, but a bit pricy”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a block from Plaza Catalunya and close to the airport bus stop. Great location. The breakfast buffet was good and great choices. The staff was always helpful and friendly and spoke English. Room was nice, and not too small. Recommendation if you face the pedestrian street - to avoid the noise, close the original door and window in addition to the modern sliding glass door - that will definitely keep out the noise although not 100%. There is an elevator. It's not very cheap but maybe being in a big city in a central location that was a normal price. The hotel has internet, but it's expensive. Try an internet cafe instead.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Norma58
Reviews.Content: Lovely,comfortable hotel in ideal location near to Catalunya square. All requests were granted including an upgrade to a superior room. All staff were pleasant and efficient and a minor problem with hot water on the last morning was quickly fixed. Breakfast was plentiful and varied and was served in a lovely marquee. Building work continues in this pedestrianised area, but noise was not a problem. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: arkholme1
Reviews.Content: Great location, bags of character, helpful staff, excellent room with lovely en-suite bathroom. The breakfast is 30 euros, a bit steep, but top quality with lots of fresh fruit and good coffee. I'd go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Teithwyr
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated just a short walk from the Aerobus bus stop. Friendly staff, good room, nice balcony. Breakfast was included in our Laterooms.com price of 99 Euros per night. Breakfast was excellent. Had it not been free I would not have paid the 15 Euros charged for breakfast as I simply don't normally eat so much for breakfast, but there was something for everyone, from bacon and eggs to youghurt, fruit and cereals. During our stay there was extensive building work going on opposite the hotel and to the hotel's facade itself. The building next door is also being completely rebuilt. We were is the room furthest away from all this building work (214) and so we were no affected in the slightest by any noise or disturbance. The pleasant balcony had a comfy sofa but we didn't use it as we were too busy seeing the sights of Barcelona. My only complaint, echoing an earlier review, is the 5 Euros per night charged for the safe in the room. If they can't trust their staff then there should be at most a nominal charge for a safe. If you use this hotel, don't waste money on a taxi from the airport unless you have really heavy baggage. The Aerobus was cheap and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end of summer break”
Reviews.Author: coolcatAlgarve
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, really good service from the staff. Loved the outside pool and the breakfast buffet was plentiful. Small ish rooms but good sized bathroom and who on earth is going to do spend time in the hotel room in Barcelona. So much to do. Will definitely use this hotel again, saves all that trawling round the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: shazarr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a romantic pre christmas break and we were pleasantly surprised! The location is great for shopping and sight seeing! Staff were very helpful, their english was not great but it was far superior to our spanish!! We had a front facing room which i guess was on a busy pedestrian street, but no cars so why complain?? We people watched from our window, it was fun! The hotel was old but beautiful! Do not stay here if you like all your modern ammenities to be just so , but do stay here if you want a central, charasmatic, and romantic hotel in the heart of barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic" will use again!!”
Reviews.Author: couture-queen
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to Barcelona for a long weekend.What can I say, I already read the review's and on arrival we were quite pleased. Room was clean and also the bed linen...which as a cleaning freak, means alot!! Bathroom was also spotless.. Destination of this hotel is perfect! You are in the middle of the town, all shop's in the same street!(take flat's girl's, shop's, shop's and shop's) Plenty of bar's, resturants to choose from.Harbour only a 10-15 minnute stroll, beautiful! also beach isn't very far. As a visitor I would go again... Oh yes and the breakfast is buffet style, plenty to choose from.. you will no be dissapointed...great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Still under construction”
Reviews.Author: Poor_grad_student
Reviews.Content: We booked the Catalonia Albinoni as part of an Orbitz package (air + hotel) at the very last minute for four nights. I was pleasantly surprised -- the staff here are amazing. For example, I left my sunglasses at breakfast and got them back the next morning. We arrived without advance notice at 9am and they had a room ready and clean for us. There is always someone at the front desk. The hotel has an amazing location. If you're coming in from the airport, you get off the RENFE train at Passieg de Gracia and walk about 4 blocks to the hotel. The hotel is in a pedesterianized area in the old town (but close enough to the metro so that you feel safe at night), one block from Las Rambla, one block from the Placa Catalyuna metro stop, and about two city blocks from the cathedral. There's a supermarket in the basement of the Cortes Ingles department store (not the one next to the hotel, the bigger one one block away at Placa Catalyuna). We basically didn't need public transit (except to get to Monjuic and La Sagrada Familiga) and walked all over the old city and the waterfront. Very convenient. The room was clean, small, and adequate. We were in room 411, which is on the top floor, with a small window that faced a blank wall (no view, alas), but the room was dead silent, even though there was construction on the hotel pool and jackhammers going less than 20 feet away. As usual for Europe, there were two twin beds that were kind of hard (in a bad way) in a very small room. The bathroom was almost the size of the sleeping area, and was very clean (towels and toiletries replaced daily). The TV didn't work, but that didn't matter much to us. You have to insert your room key to make the AC and lights go on. Upon inquiry, the breakfast buffet (normally 15 euros) was included in our Orbitz deal. I'm not sure if I would have paid the 15 euros when there were cafes all around offering a pastry and a coffee for 2 euros, but since it was included, we partook every morning. Breakfast is 7-10:30am M-F and 7:30-11am on weekends. We turned breakfast into brunch and skipped lunch. The buffet is in a new building on the back patio. You have the choice of sitting in the sun, or indoors, or when it's nice (most days), indoors with the sliding doors open. This is a very very nice buffet, with a selection of waters, wine, juices, yoghurt, cereals, fresh fruit, dried fruit (dates, figs, apricots, etc), cold cuts (including serrano ham) and cheeses, pastries (chocolate crossants, plain crossants, muffins), breads and baguettes, a toaster, a sandwich press, eggs over easy, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, and two types of torta espanola (fritatta for Italians, and egg and potato casserole for Americans); and of course, tea + coffee. Most of the food was of really high quality (I didn't venture into the American breakfast section, but had thirds of everything else). The dinner option at the hotel is almost the same price as breakfast (18 euros pp for your choice of 3 courses, including a bottle of wine and mineral water -- when you see what prices are like, even in the tapas bars, you will understand how this is a deal). I would go back, but would request that they push the beds together to form one big bed -- we didn't bother with this, but I saw one of the maids doing it in another room.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing and noisy”
Reviews.Author: twyly
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 days to celebrate my partner's birthday and our 2nd anniversary... They gave us a TWIN room! When we asked to move room, they said "tomorrow"! The day after they said "we have a double, but is smaller and with internal view"... we decided to change also because the noise of the corridor was annoing, packed the stuff and went for a day out. When we saw the room at 6pm I was horrified!! See the pictures and imagine it with a constant strong buzz of the air system. I went for complaining and they said "tomorrow". During the night we woke up for someone who decided to slam repeatedly the glass cover of the roof at 3 a.m.... i stayed up and upset for 2 hours! the morning after, our last day, they moved us in another twin. I don't know if it was a good room or it just looked good after the previous experience! So if you go for this hotel make sure they give you the right room!!! Ah, don't take the breakfast!! it really doesn't worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: davidmitch
Reviews.Content: great hotel. Location was superb. It's on a pedestrianised street so although lots of people walking through it during the day, it's very quiet at night. We had a room with a balcony at the front, and although a smallish room, we weren't really in it that much! Breakfast was good and facilities ok(could have done with tea making in room) but apart from that I can't fault it. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sarakk
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is definitely its location. You are central to everything - shops, tourist buses, airport bus, cathedral, restaurants. Breakfast which was included with the website we booked was good - lots of choice. Room was adequate, we were at the back, on the third floor with a balcony, which contained a table and two chairs, overlooking residential apartments - not a great view but fine. Simple room - bathrooms could do with some kind of extractor fan though. Staff were friendly - although we did ask one evening for them to book a taxi for us the next morning, as we had an appointment, which they assured us they would do. The omitted next morning to let us know there had been a problem and we were left high and dry - but did manage to get our own taxi later in Placa de Catalunya. Small gripe though.

Reviews.Title: “fabtastic location”
Reviews.Author: jnhroche
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is supberb. Right in the heart of the city, walking distance to las ramblas, hard rock cafe, tube station. The room itself was standard. I traveled with two children. The breakfast was pricey but after the first morning we went out for breakfast at a fraction of the cost. Housekeeping was excellent the room cleaned to a high standard every day. no hesitation in recommending it , would stay there again because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “A good but not excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Judybert47
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is average, though perhaps a bit worn. Since we were travelling in Aug. air conditioning was important for us, and it was very good. However we were disappointed that the safe, another requirement of ours, was not electronic and we had to pay 4 Euros a day for the lock. The hotel is very large in an impressive but again, somewhat worn building, and so sometimes waiting for the elevator was a chore and we took the stairs. One of the staff members was very helpful in confirming our ongoing flight, another wasn't. The brunch was very nice. The location was excellent in terms of getting anyplace we wanted to go--we're enthusiastic tourists. But the hotel fronts on the Avenida which in Aug. is packed with people, to the extent that our taxi couldn't turn onto it when we arrived and instead we had to walk 1/2 a block. Leaving at 5:45 AM this was no problem. Personally I didn't like the crowds, either on the Avenida or on the Ramblas but others might not mind them, and of course, in other months they might be less dense.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: southernexplorer
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better location than this hotel. Only one block from the metro, La Ramblas (the main street for strolling in the evenings), and the cathedral and in the midst of lots of shopping. But despite being in the midst of it all -- our room was absolutely quiet. If you enjoy walking (like we do), you could easily get down to the beach or up to La Sagrada Familia or other Gaudi treasures on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: StewartNottingham
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheap, clean hotel in a good location. I couldn't believe how good a hotel this was for the money we paid. I had read reviews about the breakfast being a bit pricy but it was included in our deal and was a very nice spread. I would agree that it was a bit expensive if you were having to pay extra but I felt it did have a good choice. The room was very nice, clean and a lot larger than expected. It looked out onto the breakfast room at the back of the hotel (we had requested a quiet room i.e. not at the front) and had a balcony. There was some work going on to the adjacent building but not early morning or late at night and has probably been completed by now. I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: heiranig
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable, good service. What we liked most about the hotel is its location: close to Las Ramblas yet quite peaceful, right on a nice shopping street, surrounded by lots of boutiques and restaurants. Walking distance to everything. An address to keep in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location and character”
Reviews.Author: LondonLondoner
Reviews.Content: Perfect location: two minutes from Catalunya Square, the metro and the Rambla. An interesting building with a faded but impressive central staircase. Rooms a bit 1970s and ours had the world's least impressive view (see picture). More than adequate breakfast served in a stunning marquee/conservatory (also benefitting from a complete lack of any view). Not the height of luxury but a winner for being centrally-located, clean and slightly quirky.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedG
Reviews.Content: Firstly I must say that this hotel was fine.Nice breakfast with a mix of things to eat so you could easily fill up for the morning. Right in the centre of everything. Staff were friendly enough but a bit reserved. One of the reception staff who spoke very good english did take the time to explain about the opentop tour buses to us which was really helpful. Old part of town is the best near the cathedral, which is only a couple of minutes walk away. Lovely little streets, boutique shops and ice cream and tapas bars! Open top bus tour is good but a bit slow. However, as Jet2 lost my bag on the way there and I was left with no luggage for the full duration of my stay Tues to Fri this did put a damper on things. The airport staff were rude unfriendly, unhelpful and had no sense of customer service at all. Most of the shop staff in Barcelona do not speak English and this became a nightmare when trying to buy everyday items such as deodorant and knickers ! Overall, I wouldnt go back to Barcelona unless it was for something special when there is the rest of the world to see - the Spanish need some lessons from New Yorkers on customer service thats for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: RobRoy34
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to Barcelona. After reading the excellent reviews, I had booked my entire stay at the Albinoni. I was very disappointed. The hotel is in a very very convenient location for a tourist. A+ for that. The staff was courteous but not knowledgeable at all. The room was BAD. The bathroom stank like a sewer. Our complaints to the front desk had no results. If we opened the bathroom door, the bedroom started smelling. Since we stayed there for 3 days, we did not want to spend our time switching hotels. The kids would rather use the bathroom elsewhere than the bathroom. The temperature control in the bedroom did not work and the room was very very hot. We slept with the windows to the inner courtyard open. The laundry service resulted in my wife's sweaters shrinking to half the original size. Breakfast buffet at the Albinoni is very very good. Despite this, Barcelona has become one of my favorite cities. I am looking forward to my next visit there. The Picasso museum and the Dali museum in Figueras are simply outstanding. If you like museum visits, I suggest that you plan a day each. The walking tour from the TI is very very good We had an energetic Swiss lady (who migrated to Barcelona years ago), as a tour guide. Excellent visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cornwall
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel. It's position is first class, near the Ramblas and Gothic Quarter. It's falcilitiesare good [breakfast, bar etc.] just don't have a room in the front [the noise is loud at night from passing people - we took a time to settle] Barcelona is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IHST66
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this Hotel and had a fab time. We just wanted a comfortable 3 * Hotel in the centre of it all. Relaxabroad.com picked this for us and we were not disappointed. The rooms were comfortable and clean and what you would expect from a 3* Hotel. The location is great just off the Plaza Catalunyna near to the Ramblas. Would definatley recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Take care of your belongings”
Reviews.Author: Saorla
Reviews.Content: I would like to advise visitors to watch their personal belongings. On Saturday morning, Sept 16 while I ate breakfast downstairs in the hotel, my lap-top, camera and mobile phone were stolen from my 4th floor bedroom. The hotel manager and police concluded that an intruder had entered the room when the door was open as the maid cleaned the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in a fab location in wonderful Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Contented_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catalonia Albinoni and would thoroughly recommend it as well as Barcelona itself. The hotel is in a lovely buliding in a fab location and its that quiet that its a shock when you step out into the busy street in the morning. Our room faced into an internal courtyard and whilst that means theres no view it is so peaceful and cool. We went in august and needed the air conditioning on all the time which I admit was nosiy. We left it on all day with the curtains closed and were able to turn it off at night. The bathroom was a lovely large red marble affair with a great shower. Parts of the hotel are in need of a touch of paint but thats really it (its is an old buliding after all). The staff were really friendy (didn't meet any rude ones at all). The maids came in every day as requested and the room was spotless (especially the bathroom). The breakfast was great too and good value (in as much as its included if you book with expedia). The best thing about this hotel though is the location. We walked everywhere from here including Parc Guell (just head straight up P. De Gracia) and Montjuic - both of which I would recommend if only for the veiws. Most evenings we ate on the P. De Gracia and would thoroughly recommend Citrus about halfway up as well as No No Bar and Grill.

Reviews.Title: “They won us over”
Reviews.Author: LondonKimberley
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure about this hotel at first - it needs a bit of TLC and a lick of paint in some areas, but the staff made it for us. We didn't see one rude member of staff - all were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is extremely well located and being on the fourth floor we didn't hear any noise at all - even though Barcelona had just won the league and the streets were alive with cheering mobs of football fans when we arrived! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SabineIsrael
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, nice room, fantastic location, nice breakfast. Still very expensive for a 3 star hotel and a pity that as everywhere in Barcelona the English of the staff was very limited. At the reception it was OK for standard questions, but as soon as we wanted some more sophisticated information, they did not know to answer us. But all together the staff was very nice and helpful and I warmly recommend the hotel to whoever can afford their price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel...apart from the rude staff”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in March 2006. Hotel was very easy to find (2 min wallk from the Plaza Catalunya (catch the A10 bus from the Airport - EUR3.75) Hotel room was spacious even with the 3 of us sharing. Air conditioning was useless and the rooms were very sticky at night. Location was perfect for walking around and catching the tour buses from the Plaza Catalunya. Great shops available just outside the hotel (good for last minute bargains). Only complaint was the staff - very rude and did not smile! Also, they forgot to mention that a marathan was happening which ran right in front of the hotel and caused traffic chaos (not good as we were checking out that day).

Reviews.Title: “No complaints whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: stoofer
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying here and cannot fault the hotel in anyway. Big spacious room on 4th floor with balcony and table and chairs, though not used in Feb. very clean, staff very helpful. Excellent buffet breakfast with large range of hot and cold savoury dishes as well as cakes!! Ideal location, only one minute walk to Ramblas, Placa de Catalunyia and cathederal. Got good deal with Globespan - flight+4 nights B&B for just under £200.

Reviews.Title: “Good location shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Other reviews complain about not having double beds, believe me you were very lucky! We asked for and got adouble bed, the downside was it was a very small double in the smallest hotel room we have ever stayed in with a tiny bathroom too! The thermostat in the room was not working and the engineer arrived to fix it on the morning we left( 5days). The tv only had spanish channels working because, according to the very offhand manager, we dont have rain in Barcelona so cannot make the system work when the weather is bad. Good points - 2 of the staff were very helpful ( the others were not interested), the hotel is clean but very basic, and is in perfect location. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou for a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited Barcelona in May for 3 nights to celebrate my 40th Birthday. We had a wonderful time what a great city. This hotel is lovely, very well situated for sight seeing & shopping. We had a quiet room at the back with a lovely little balcony where we sat & shared the bottle of wine that had been very thoughtfully left in our room by the hotel staff (what a nice suprise, I never mentioned my Birthday to them). We are hoping to return to Barcelona in the future as 3 days is not long enough, we will definitely stay at this hotel again.
